I recommend the steak sandwich. Grab a sandy, a Kombucha tea and some homemade Kim-chi and you'll be in heaven.
author: Walter K.

description: I was yelping for a grilled cheese and I stumbled upon Rhea's.  Yeah!  This place had great sandwiches: Korean steak sandwich is worth the wait.
author: PukaShell s.

description:
I think I stumbled into this liquor store once while hammered because I needed some salt+vinegar chips action.  Little did I know the sandwich perfection that lay dormant inside.

Like the much-lamented Mission Burger, Rhea's transcends its humble surroundings with a decadent meat + cheese fugue.  In your mouth.  Yeah.

Got a Mission St (basically a reuben: pastrami, cheese, slaw, pickled jalapenos, mustard + garlic aioli held together by two fantastic slices of Tartine country loaf).  Was perfectly balanced, with each ingredient able to be distinguished without overwhelming the whole.  Salty, fatty, sweet, sour, spicy.  Just when you think the sandwich is lacking texture, you get a crunch of tartine crust, and all is right in the world.

It's also HUGE.  I ate the second half not because I was still hungry, but because I didn't want the mouth happiness to end.

Miles better than that famously precarious dirty sandwich shop that shall remain unnamed.

Will be back for the Korean steak sandwich.  And the pork katsu.  And the chicken katsu.  And the korean steak taco.  And the hot link.  And the Cunningham.  In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.
author: Alex K.

description: The best vegan sandwich anyplace I've ever been. Hands down! Great cole slaw, spicy, yummy, convenient, and filling.
author: vera c.

description: The spicy veggie chicken sandwich is a perfect hangover antidote.  That's about all you need to know.  It rules!!  Move over Ike's, there's a new sandwich in my life.
author: Emily T.

description: big sandwich.  tasty.   i thought it was better than deliboard.  crunchy roll.  flavorful as well.  left very satisfied.   i had the korean meat one and another one with breaded chicken.  both were yummioso.  top 3 sandwich places for me in the bay.
author: Bing S.

description: The Korean BBQ beef sandwich was def 5 stars. It was huge(and I'm a big eater!) and messy. Eat it as soon as possible because the meat juices cause it to get soggy and fall apart towards the end. That sandwich alone is worth a trip back. The other two sandwiches we had were alright but nothing memorable. Also, they have the most extensive selection of Ritter Chocolate I've ever seen.
author: Rina C.

description: Huge Fan! I love this place, so far I've had the Valencia, the Korean BBQ , and roast beef (cant remember their name for it) sandwiches, all have been delicious.  Trust their menu, at first I was unsure if flavors would be good together, but I haven't been let down yet. I live around the coroner from Ike's which always has a crazy line, Rhea's is just as good, if not better, reasonably priced and it doesnt take an hour to get a sandwich.
author: Nicole A.

description:
So i am handicapped due to crazy circumstance i cant just walk to the store so since they opened they have been my godsend for smokes snacks etc normally this would be a 5 star review but due to what happened tonight notice the 1 star 
i called at 3:45 pm to get 2 packs of smokes delivered about 20 min later i called back hoping to catch the delivery guy so i could add a soda was told he already left would be here soon so i said thanks 
4:45 i call back hey um you guys said the driver left like an hour ago whats the deal ? let me  call he shoulda been there a while ago 
5:45 um so whats the deal with the delivery ? i really dont mean to bitch but its been a shitty day i really want a smoke 2 hrs is more than patient AND HERE FOLKS IS WHY THE 1 STAR the response from girl on phone 
and i quote "me and the delivery guys frankly dont care about you or your 2 packs of smokes " i told her to cancel the order id just call the awesome bike messengers who may charge more but aren't rude to there customers woman at rhea's" stop being bitchy they are headed to soma in a bit" me whatever just cancel the order i call all the time never been treated so badly 
5:50 i call back i want to talk to the manager " im the manager your smokes just arnt a priority and your being a bitch " 

5:55 i call the awesome that is TCB courier can i get 2 packs of smokes "sure Kris on folsom right be there 15 -20 min how you feeling ?"

6:15 messenger arrives " hey i went to and got your order from rhea's it's on me glad your feeling better" i told him what mod at rhea's said he asked me not to believe her he just wasn't given  my order for 45 min in the first place or he def would have come faster  that the messengers have no issue with me just her problem be it that there here all the time i kinda believe him over "mod" at rhea;s 

to summarize Rhea's is usually amazing and i would recommend it to anyone there delivery people are amazing nice and always polite however TO THE OWNER the Mod who was one thursday at 5:45 should be fired if she thinks its ok to call a customer a bitch and say that they and there order dont matter 

i will be calling the owner tomorrow to tell him to applaud his delivery guy and fire the rude nasty manager who clearly doesn't care about his business or customers . 

I would like to note there food is great i love there sandwiches they remind me of my fav home town deli in NY
author: Kristen H.

description: Not really a deli so much as a corner liquor bunker. But it's surprisingly large, and friendly. It does have the unique distinction of being in perhaps one of the ugliest buildings in the entire city (okay, top 25), and it's the kind of place that makes you want to buy a bottle of Smirnoff and a can of Kerns. But hey. Ain't nothing wrong with that.
author: Megan W.

description:
veggie bbq chicken sammy was delicious, so delicious we went back twice in one week (the five stars are for this treat!). they are great for eating in the park with your sweetheart. with three levels of spicyness, be cafeful! we like hot stuff and ordered medium, i'm afraid of what hot would be like. sometimes it takes a while to get it, but i just heard you can call ahead the order. i think we'll start. 
p.s. the fellas are heck of friendly.
author: Ale M.

description: I looks (looked, actually, since they got new signage) like any average sketchy corner store in the Mission.  But step inside and they have some of the greatest sandwiches in the Mission, or even the city.  Highly recommend the vegetarian BBQ chicken.  I usually have to get mine mild, because the spicy sauce is super spicy, but I can be kind of a wimp about spicy, so take this advice with a grain of salt.  Best place after Bi-Rite to grab picnic supplies for Dolores Park.
author: Gloria A.

description: Amazing, must try the Korean beef sandwich...sooooo good. Along with IKE's-the best sandwich in the bay.
author: Neil W.

description: Jesus Christ can this place make a fucking sandwich.  Get the van ness, one of the most flavorful concoctions of bread, meat, and like 10 different sauces that I've ever tried.  I would say this place rivals Ike's, no fucking joke.
author: Karthik K.

description: Awesome, just awesome.  Not that these guys need another 5 star review, but I'll give it to em.  Word of advice - call your order in ahead.  You'll save 20-30 minutes of hanging out on the corner in the mission if you do.
author: Bowie R.

description: The Korean Steak Sandwich at Rhea's Deli is on par with the best in the city, but ask for the mild version if you can't handle the heat cause its a spicey sando.
author: Brian S.

description: I live in the Mission and love a good sandwich, so I finally decided to try Rhea's. I chose the Korean Beef, as I'd heard good things about that one. In short, I have no need to ever visit here again. The service was unfriendly and the store itself was a total mess with boxes & bags lying all around. The sandwich was ok... I've definitely had much better sandwiches elsewhere. I can't seem to wrap my head around this place (or Ike's for that matter).  Why pile so many ingredients on a sandwich instead of letting a few great ingredients speak for themselves. The Korean Beef Sando had fresh onions AND pickled onions, 2 kinds of sauce... all kinds of things that took away from the marinated beef taste. I'll stick with Bi-Rite for my sandwiches. They have quality meats in them for the same price and they know how to deal with a large volume of business... something Rhea's needs to improve on as well. Nobody should have to wait 30 minutes for a sandwich.
author: Terry M.

description: Love the Korean BBQ - turned a bunch of people onto it and they all thank me.  Good beer & snack selection!
author: Scott C.

description: amazing sandwiches. order one of the ones they already have. the van ness is epic
author: Matthew R.

description: tHE innards of the sandwich reminded me of the innards of one of my many ex girlfriends: Korean, beefy, and salty. unlike my ex, this left my ferocious appetite satisfied ;)
author: Merland S.

description: The pork katsu sandwich is AWESOME.  Huge, a little bit sweet, and a little bit spicy.  I have never seen my coworkers so jealous of my sandwich.  Also, the guys running the counter are helpful and friendly, and it is easy to call in and pre-order.
author: Brooke G.

description: Chicken katsu sandwich is on hit! And the owner treats everyone like fam.
author: John B.

description: I've been a regular at Rhea's for close to 5 years and watched James and his young family take over the store from his parents. The gamble he took by investing in a full deli counter is what makes it so great to live in the Mission. Here's a guy who loves what he does and loves being a part of the best neighborhood in town. So what about the sammies? Well, they are simply fantastic. The quality of the product is excellent and the food is always consistent. All of this at great prices and and a cool crew. So if you're from one of the great sandwich towns in this country like NY, Philly, Chicago, Pittsburgh or elsewhere get over to Rhea's for one of James' signature creations. It's like going home without any of the crap weather.
author: Keith W.

description: The Veggie BBQ sandwich is my favorite sandwich in the whole city, and I usually don't even like faux meat!  Relaxed but prompt service,  fresh & creative ingredients, a little counter to sit at if you want to, and Kinder Eggs all for less than you'd pay at some of those other fancy sandwich shops. I heart Rhea's.
author: saru k.

description: Rhea's is my new addiction. Best sandwiches I've found in the city. My only complaint is that they don't sell Arizona Ice Tea here, but i think I'll live. Definitely check this place out!
author: ingrid H.

description: la la la loveee their sandwiches, this is my go to place for a good deli sandwich. i usually get a pastrami, with vermont cheddar, garlic aioli, spicy mustard, tomatoes, arugula, onions, avocado on a sweet roll. they have a great selection, & alternatives to everything. might just stop by there today haha.
author: Tila S.

description: Rhea's is keeping me in the Mission and San Francisco. So glad to have finally found a sandwich shop I love. Without a doubt my favorite meal in the city - is that wrong? Don't know what I'd do without the Katsu sandwich.
author: Rebecca P.

description: the veggie BBQ chicken on acme bread is fantastic. take it to go and eat it in the park, and you've got a perfect day.
author: Roman H.

description: just tried the $3 grilled cheese, AWESOME!!!!  super crispy due to panini press.  comes with two different cheeses, tomato.  the bread is spread with a light aioli and mustard, which really adds a kick.  try adding pickled onions, they're greeeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaat!
author: Aimee B.

description: Get the katsu sandwich.  A little spicy, great coleslaw, awesome breaded pork, good roll.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Zoran M.

description: at first i was a little hesitant to see how good a sandwich could be from a liquor store, but definitely surpassed my expectations. the korean steak sandwich was yummy! for the price, it was a good size too. good for grabbing and go
author: Ely K.

description: They make the best sandwich's I ever had! You will not regret trying anything at this place. Don't be thrown by the environment its worth it.
author: Kelly P.

description: the best! wonderful people, excellent sandwiches, and really fun english candy.
author: Miranda T.

description: It's hard to find a good sandwich in the Mission but you can at Rhea's.  They've got a great selection but I can't stay away from the Katsu.  If you like spicy order it as is, if not let them know.
author: Sean Q.

description: very solid sandwich , had the korean steak and it had lots of flavor , the garlic sauce is amazing the put the right amount of ingredients , generous on the meat , really like that place and i think it could be the next ike in town
author: NAEL K.

description: some of the best and most inventive sandwiches in san francisco. ive had the pork katsu, the korean steak, and the van ness [which is chicken katsu], and have been thoroughly impressed by all three. i really enjoy the korean flare and that theyre not afraid to spice things up. even better...they deliver. i dont know of any other delis with a delivery option. a fucking plus.
author: Jon W.

description: This place doesn't look like much from the outside but if you're looking for a great deli sandwich in the mission, it's definitely worth going to. My friend and I were craving deli sandwiches and didn't want to brave the line at BiRite so we walked a little further to this place. The deli counter looked pretty empty so don't expect pretty sliced meats or cheeses displayed inside but one look at the sandwich menu and you should be sold. They have invented some amazing combinations if you don't feel like designing your own sandwich. You just fill out your sheet of paper with along with any special requests, pay at the counter and prepare your stomache for utter bliss. We got 19th steet and it was amazing and only like 8 bucks. Try this place, you won't regret it/
author: theresa v.

description: The Korean Steak Sandwich is to die for. I bought one today to take home, my husband gobbled up half my sandwich before I could blink. The meat was tasty, lean and plentiful. The Acme roll was of course amazing. My mouth still burns a little half an hour after the sandwich. I'm very happy there's now a good sandwich place close by so I don't have to trek to Ike's!
author: gor d.

description: This is my neighborhood corner store and I thank the gods that it's owned by an incredibly nice family who employ cool guys because I am so lazy I'd probably end up going there anyway.  I've actually had moments where I thought about going to Safeway and thought "nah, I'm just gonna hit the corner store cause they're cool"--or something to that effect.
author: Ken P.

description: My fave corner store, and there are 4 within the general radius of my digs. Cool staff. Stocked with basics and munchies. They have dog treats for the local pups.
author: betty r.

description:
Generally, I avoid buying anything edible beyond a candy bar or pint of ice cream from a corner store. This is because food made at most corner stores in my experience looks disgusting. 
Rheas is an exception. 
I've been going there since I moved to the city five years ago. The staff has always been super friendly and when I learned they were putting in a sandwich shop earlier this year I was excited (although sad that they no longer had lotto scratchers because I swear it was the luckiest place to buy them, I won more then I lost, it was freaky. They stopped carrying scratchers to save help save money for the deli I'm guessing). Anyway. The sandwiches. They are some of the best sandwiches I have eaten in San Francisco. The korean steak, the pork katsu, the lexington st ham sandwich. You can't go wrong. I highly recommend getting a sandwich at Rheas. The staff is very friendly as they have always been and the prices are more then fair. I may not be able to purchase my beloved lotto scratchers there anymore, but the sandwiches are so good that I don't mind so much.
author: k d.

description: Yummy Yummy Yummy!!! I love the new sandwiches! My faves are the Katsu, and the Tuna. James makes a really unique tuna salad that is not full of mayo! I love it. I recommend it on the Tartine bread... I warn you though, they are addictive!
author: Jj F.

description: this place has it together: clean, cheap, the people are nice and usually there're some pretty good tunes rockin!
author: Paul M.
